content: Frustrated. Used free app for years LOVED! Month-ish ago timer stopped going off if I was looking at another app and didn't have this app up on my screen or if my screen was asleep. I'd notice that it had gone past the time the timer should have alarmed and so I'd bring up the app and as soon as I would the alarm would start ringing. I decided to buy the app to see if that would help. It hasn't. üôÅ Is there a setting I'm missing? It is no good to me the way is. Running android 11.
replyContent:
That's due to the device battery optimization settings.

Have a look at "Alarm doesn't go off on time" of the FAQ. https://studionekonobi.jp/android/MultiTimer/docs/help/ver_1/en/faq.html

content: This app is everything and more than what I was initially looking for. I have been quite impressed with everything so far. I like being able to place a name to the timer, but to be able to also have as many timers as I want and being able to save them all means it will work much easier once I get it programed in. It does way more than I expected and this is why I still love the app and use it daily!!! Great job you guys. Great app!
I like the app, to me is great and it worth every cent I paid for it, the interface and the opci√≥ns it have to costuming is too wide.
Capable, complex, and inspired, a kind of building-blocks approach enables you to do all that you want, but you have to learn to use the blocks it provides.

Have used this app for years and have been extremely pleased with the flexibility, especially in being able to label each alarm. Purchased the paid version to support the developer. To the person who couldn't enable sound and vibration together, I had that problem for a while and realized the speaker icon at the top was on mute. Great app!
Purchased the premium version to support the developer, as the free version is great. Highly customizable to suit any use case.
Excellent app! Using paid version as a token of appreciation or gratitude.

I think it's a very helpful app, and there really are some pretty awesome features. Money well spent for sure! But I still can't change the settings to make it play any sounds on alarm. For whatever the reason that darn thing only vibrates, I can't figure it out... lol
replyContent:
Most likely, you happened to press the app sound mode button and the app is in the vibration mode (not device but the app vibration mode). You need to press the button again to change the mode to Sound ON mode.
Have a look at "Alarm does not sound" of the FAQ. https://studionekonobi.jp/android/MultiTimer/docs/help/ver_1/en/faq.html

content: Time is everything in this busy life of ours and we can't always keep track of everything. Luckily this app can hold tons of timers plus very specific and detailed settings. What needs to happen and when becomes a synch. Just launch your timers to go off when or before things need to happen and see how much time you have left to do it. Close your app and forget about it. The app alarm still goes off and it's got you covered. Was so impressed that I bought the add free version.
Doesn't let you create multiple stopwatches... Therefore only provides half of the functionality. Seriously. How hard is it to make a timer that counts up???
replyContent: Answering how hard to implement the count up. It's not difficult at all if I implement it in the new app but difficult to implement in the current app without impacting the existing functions. The app has so many options and it's extremely tough to implement the new function making sure all other functions are not impacted.

content: Definitely my go to timer.
Excellent app. Very clean, well organized with lots of useful features.
I've been a professional programmer for over 40 years and am generally appalled by today's quality. This is first rate! I'd be proud if I had written it myself. Kudos!
This is my absolute favorite timer app. I swear, they have thought of EVERYTHING!!! Gladly purchased to support the dev. Extremely robust, with toons of functionality. Highly recommend!

Edit Nov 2020: Ver 4.5.0 fixed all problems, 5 stars again! Edit Oct 2020: alarming stopped working since moving to Android 10, dev please consider adding the START_ACTIVITIES_FROM_BACKGROUND permission, thanks. Excellent multi-timer app worth the purchase!

This app is great! I can cook all my favourite recipes now without having to worry about setting the next timer! Just when I thought the app could be improved by grouping timers, I checked the settings and, 'lo and behold, there was an option to move timers to another group! ¬£1.25 is way too cheap for the amount of hassle it saves, really.
Despite turning off alarm logs I'm still seeing several days worth of logged events in my notification drop-down menu
replyContent: History Record size has nothing to do with the end notification. If you don't want to see the end notifications (and see only alarm notification), change "App Menu - Settings - Notification and History Settings - Ended Timer Notification" option to "No notification". If you are talking about something else, send me email at catfantom@gmail.com

content: Very good except the LED notification light didn't flash after an alarm.
Does not go in foreground when alarm goes off, unreliable.
Really good multi timer with lots of customization possible.
I didn't buy the full version bec of the ads, I only wanted to support the dev team. You made a very wonderful tool and it has really affected my life. Thank you so very much!
Amazing app, bought it just because I liked the free one so much. Keep up the good work :)!
Very good! I had problems but the developer quickly told me how to fix them. Most practical timer on the store

If you need to time things this app does it extremely well. I have no issues with the app at all. Just buy it and use it. Edit - two years on! I seem to use this app more and more. OK, it's just a timer, but it seems to be much more. It is quick and faultless. I recently discovered timer groups, my bread making which involves all manner of waits has been revolutionised. Just buy it and use it - oh, I said that already!
Love this app

Could you please add this: When the timer ended the trianguler button color could be changed. So I know at a glance the counter is ended. What I see is that only the text color can be changed when the counter ended but not the button. Or you can add an option where when the counter ended the text and the button will have the same color.

This is excellent 5* timer app. Nice icon and themes. Many tweaks allowed. Very reliable. However there is one thing that is missing for my needs/wants/looks: Could you please implement a one level subgroup that could be ran with one touch? Let me try explain what I mean by simple example: Let's say I have a group of timers called "Sleeping". There I would like to have 3 timers. Two timers are simple: one is "8 Hours Sleep" and another one is "26 Minutes Power Nap". However third timer in this group would be complex"Get to Work on Time" and would consist of three linked timers: "Wake up in 8 hours" + "Make sure that you're awake in 10 minutes" + "Make sure that you exit house within 20 minutes". So when I open group "Sleeping" I would like to see only 3 timers to run (2 simple and 1 chained (group)) and not 5 timers. It would be nice if I could run such subgroup just as easy as I can run simple timers. So far as a workaround, to keep it nice, I have created "Sleeping" group and a group called "Extras" and linked my 3rd alarm to other alarms in "Extras". While it keeps group "Sleeping" clean and tidy, group "Extras" is a mess, as there are also extra linked timers for cooking and many other complex alarms from other groups. Please consider and thanks in advance.
replyContent: I've added your request to the wish-list.

content: This is the absolute best timer app. It has so many functions. You can have multiple timers running and they keep running even if you reboot. You can set your own sounds for each individual timer when they go off. You can link timers to start when one ends. You can see a history of fired timers. You can set a different color for each timer. You can change font sizes. This app still gets good updates. Well worth the money.
Great app very useful, well executed.
I'm very happy with the way this app works. I can name timers, link timers, reset automatically (or not if I choose) and a miriad of other options. Very useful for training, cooking and more.

1) This App is SO COMPLICATED, with WAY TOO MANY SETTING, options & adjustments, you need to simplify it! 2) PLZ FIX MULTIPLE ALARMS going at the same time, doesn't work? ‚òπÔ∏èüëé We use 3-4 at the same time, we come back in 1-4 hours later & they've STOPPED or are INACCURATE? ‚òπÔ∏èüëé something IS WRONG? Except For These 2 Things, THIS APP HAS BEEN OUTSTANDING üòÄüëç
It would be difficult to suggest a useful addition to this app
Use it to keep on track to get everything I have to get done on my to do lists. I often spent more time on a task if I didn't get a reminder
When it comes to timers, for whatever purpose, this app is without peer...
By far the best timer app I've ever used. The developer is responsive as well. The level of customization and flexibility is amazing. Highly recommended.
Very nice
Excellent performance. I urge people to encourage the developer by buying it. It costs a mere Rs.100/-

Super timer with a bazillion customization options. One question, when displaying two different apps side by side, the countdown doesn't animate while focus is on the other app. Any way to get around this. Using Android 7. Probably the device. Asus Zenpad P008 that didn't receive much manintenance updates after release. But thanks for looking!
replyContent: Hi, I've put the workaround in the new beta version to solve the issue.  You can try the beta version by being a beta tester. To be a beta tester, go to Google Play Multi Timer page and go to "Become a beta tester" section and click "I'M IN".

content: Really good but if it had widgets I would use it more.
Excellent. Fully customisable

This App is simply amazing. It has almost all the features one can need in a Timer System. Perhaps in the future there can be a feature where selected groups can only be accessed via a password. That would make it a five star App. My compliments to the creator of this App.
Always done exactly what was needed, to label timers and set them off when needed, and there's a ton of additional options available too.

FINALLY! This is the timer app I've been after for years. I've probably tried 3 dozen countdown timer apps, this is the only one that gives me the granular control I want for setting dynamic multi-stage repeating countdown timers. The learning curve is a bit steeper than most since there are SO many options, but the payoff is well worth it.
Best multi-timer out there
Best timer ever, I like that it has eveeerything able to setup, except I miss one thing - connection to actual time. But 5 stars definitely
A lot of features, clean, easy to back up timers. Thank you for making something that just works!

After an eye operation I had to change position every 20, 10, 30 minutes during waking hours for 10 days. This app helped me keep this going. I set 3 timers and linked them together. Am very pleased with the app.
I've been using this app for acoipleof years and it has been consistently, reliable, easy to use, and indispensable to me. Thanks

This is Perfect. This is exactly what I want. Simple as the Name says. No gimmick. Please Never Give Up on Creating Simple Useful Apps. You Know how to do it. And Thanks A Ton For the App. Really Liked it.

Great app, can modify every setting you want. Also nicely written code, so that everything works as expected. Importantly even with my phone's aggressive battery optimisation it seems to run happily in the background, whilst many other apps don't.

Consistently updated and improved. Kept modern and functional. The best multi timer I've been able to find. Tons of options to customize, so you can get exactly what you need. Excellent app. Update February 6 2020: Awesome app, still updated regularly and quickly. Super useful!
replyContent: I don't think ugliest but I'll listen to your comment :-)  By the way, the notification shows the expected end time or remaining time of the nearest timer. Pulling down is to see the same of all the timers.  I don't under stand what you mean.  Can you send me your request to catfantom@gmail.com with more details?

content: Happy
Great design and options. Versatile!
Need an option to import my history from the Free version of the app. Thanks for making this app.

content: Great app! I have an improvement idea: it would be good if there's an independent alarm volume, separate from the phone, personally, I would like to have Multi Timer volume high and keep all other phone notifications low.
Great app..

Exactly what I need to time my irrigation blocks on the farm. It's uncomplicated and works perfectly. Thanks a lot. Will you please add an option to swipe the screen to move through timer groups.
Like it alot , use it more than any other timer.
This is the MULTI timer that I've been looking for...
Excellent. Really configurable and well thought out. Could be prettier though...
Excellent app with tons of settings to customize the app
Very pleased with MultiTimer. I appreciate the extensive customization possible. Once I saw that it could do what I wanted, I upgraded to the paid version to eliminate the ads.
Essential. Flexible.

Excellent experience all around. Ive probably used close to 500-1k apps over the years and actually purchased around 10 total (max!). This was one of them because of how useful, feature rich and well laid out it is. App just works flawlessly and has 10x the features of stock timer app. Would recommend 10 out of 10

content: Does what it says it does.

It's great. But I have a serious problem. I need a widget that will allow to press the play button. It blows my mind that a timer app doesn't have a widget. Maybe I'm just not seeing it.
Had this app for about 1 year, use all the time never ever caused me an issue, ads were unobtrusive in the free version, just paid for full version to show my appreciation.
not as described

Worth every Penny. Highly customizable settings, interface, color. Loads of Timer Settings, different (customizable) Timer Lists/Groups. Will be my main Timer App from now on.   Looks very nice in Black+Neon Color on OLED Screen (Samsung S9)
I time multiple students at the same time and this app works great. They can have the same or different start times. Love it.
Great timer. I do a lot of grilling and use this app to time most of my cooking. Very handy
great , I need time restraints and this fits well.
Extremely Functional! Well thought & planned. Appearance is also intuitive. Worth 3x !

Very good timer. If I had a request, it would be to allow the stopwatch to also be allowed a lock screen notification. Currently only timers can display on the lock screen. If I am using it for running its nice to jot have to unlock the phone to check the stopwatch.
Great so far

only 99 days, need 360. bit odd to set such limit, but what can you do.

This App is not being shown in the exceptions list for the Do Not Disturb button. LG V30 - T-Mobile
what it says it does well

Timer has great functipnality EXCEPT it won't play an alarm it just vibrates. Not good. Update: It turns out that, on my Sony Xperia phone, you have to check Play Even Silent Mode check box in settings to get to work even though the phone is not in silent mode.
replyContent: Thanks for the update. That's probably due to the Xperia behavior. All my test devices (Galaxy, Nexus, ASUS), alarm sounds without checking Play Even Silent Mode if the phone is not in silent mode.  I noted that as Xperia behavior.

content: Doesn't ring. great app but the timers don't alarm all the time. Can't rely on it unless the app is in the forground. Set the timers to vibrate different volumes or ringtones nothing helps.
replyContent:
That's due to the battery saver restricting the background apps.
The battery saver settings really depend on the device.
In case of Moto G6,  I found the following settings by googling.
Settings - Battery - Three-dot menu - Battery Optimization - tap on Not Optimized and change it to All apps - find the app, tap on it and select Don't optimize.

content: Function-wise, this is the best timer app. The developer is very thoughtful about what makes a perfect timer app. Thanks and keep updating the app!
very happy to use this reliable app
No subscription model, never bugged me to rate it, does what it says it will. Absolutely perfect.
This is exactly what I need, glad I found it! The vast number of settings allow configuration for every possible use case! Great app!
Usefull for everything from work to cooking, very versatile

I wanted to time how long it took to do multiple things, starting at different times. I had a misunderstanding with the nomenclature, expecting a multi stop-watch functionality. As a feature request, maybe any new timer set with time 0 can start counting up instead of down, and then be saved? That would solve my use case.  As another feature request, if it's possible please add the ability to place multiple timers into folders. I have different sets of timers depending on the context, for example cooking recipes.
replyContent: Not timer folder but timer group will be supported in the next version. Multi stopwatch is in the wishlist already.

content: This app is terrific!!! I have tried a dozen or so timer apps looking for one that did what I needed. I was ready to give up and write my own when I found this. Multi Timer allows me to create multiple timers and to link them so that one kicks off as the previous one ends. The app has very fine level of customization. For example, I can decide whether the next timer kicks off automatically as the previous one ends or to wait until I acknowledge the end of the previous timer. There is also excellent interface customization. The color of just about every object on the screen can be individually set. Configuration can be exported and imported (in my case directly to Google drive). I contacted the developer with a suggestion for an additional feature and they responded in less than 24 hours. The "no ads" version is very reasonably priced. No special permissions required. I am very impressed and highly satisfied with this app!!!

Admin helped asap with Import issue, got it resolved same day!... If anyone has issues importing a file, export it again then try importing, and repeat that till it imports. Issue will be fixed with next update. Love this app, $1.99 is a small price to pay for the work that has gone into it. Thanks again!
replyContent: I just tested (exported settings from the free version and imported into the paid version) and  it worked.  I don't know why it's not working on your device. Can you send me your exported settings file to catfantom@gmail.com so that I can look into it?

content: Use this app every day!
The best that I know off
Fantastic, just what I needed and looked for
I could not find a better app! So happy with such features, price and a free version in which I could decide to pay to support developers.
Great apps
text to speech does not work... even the other free multiple timer works,so i dont think it is my phones problem
replyContent:
That's really strange. I haven't heard TTS doesn't work on any Galaxy devices and it's working fine on my Galaxy device of Android 6.0.
That's must be a setting or operation issue.  Send me an email at catfantom@gmail.com with more details of what you did and what you expected.

content:
Very disappointed. Bought this also expecting multiple stopwatches but 
there's only one.
Great app!!!

This is a pretty much perfect MultiTimer app: Just the right amount of customisable features and a nicely built-in stopwatch. To the dev: Please resist the temptation to pile in too many more new features. I find that when apps do that they start to crash. In my view you could, for example, probably give widgets a miss. The only feature I'd really like to see added is group timers, and I note from the dev's reply to another review that these are on their way in a coming update. Thank you. I recommend this app very highly.

I really love this app and I have to give it a 5 cause it does everything 
it promises. The only feature id love for the developer to add someday 
would be the ability to have different timer sets, say one for the gym, one 
for work, one for music practice. That way each set can have its own few 
timers with their own links specific to your needs. Just a thought.
replyContent:
The next release supports Timer Group (timer set) and each group can have multiple timers. 
It's under the testing currently and will take several more weeks before the official release.
If you'd like to try it right now, you can be an early access beta version pilot user at the Multi Timer GooglePlay page.

content:
It's such a simple function but most stock clocks are useless when you need 
to use multiple timers simultaneously. Really impressed with this app - it 
does everything it claims to do, it's easy to use and highly customisable. 
It has no ads/excessive permissions, so I'm happy to pay for an app of this 
quality. Thank you :-)
Best timer, just what I needed, worth every penny.

I just found out about this app an hour ago. I rarely shell out money for 
unnecessary things in general and try sticking to free apps as much as 
possible, but I knew I would be making a great investment by purchasing 
this app. The developer is obviously very knowledgeable. This is one of the 
most customizable apps I'd ever used, and I am very fond of playing around 
with Android and customizing them in such a way that I would be able to 
meet my needs and use Android's potential as fully as possible. While I do 
admit this app isn't the prettiest and would do great in popularity by 
improving in that regard, it's on another level in terms of function. Kudos 
to the developer! Looking forward to any future apps you create in the 
future. üëç

Great app. Well worth its price and at least one level above any timer app 
I tried. Timer linking is a priceless feature, and TTS for timers is a very 
interesting. And if that's not enough, the support service is amazing! I 
requested a fix for a problem and very quickly got a satisfying solution. 
Going over the other reviews, I can see it's not an isolated incident. 
Thank you very much! It makes me happy to find such a high quality app :)
replyContent: Just place the sound files in /sdcard/Ringtones folder of your Android device and restart Multi Timer. Then you should be able to select your own sound files.

content: You'd think it wouldn't be easy to find a timer app that stands head and shoulders over others, given how basic the function is, but that's what we have here. It does exactly what it says it does, and does so very well indeed. It's extremely easy to use but its range of features make it very powerful. Wish I'd found it years ago. The developer is very responsive to suggestions, not that it's easy to find anything to suggest given how well thought through it is.

I needed an app which I didn't expect to find anywhere at all. You guys 
created something EXACTLY what I needed. I literally use all the features 
you offer. Although I cannot tell you what I do for money I can tell you 
the app paid itself in matter of seconds.

Great multi-timer. The paid version is well worth the few dollars. It 
allows for a huge variety of possible custumization, including bypassing 
thevsystem sound settings. I love the app üòÄ

Very comprehensive I use it every day for individual parts of my piano 
practice.

Great app! Can be improved with alarm settings. The volume at lower end 
should be adjusted at finer steps (essential function to me). Even better 
to allow volume settings for each alarm (good to have). In addition alarm 
should be able to go through ear phone (thanks, supported already).
replyContent: Just regarding going through ear phone,  App Menu - Settings - Alarm Settings - "Play Alarm as Media".  Check this option and the alarm sound will go through the ear phone.

content: Its the nirvana (nerdvana?) of timer apps...
Extremely customizable, very flexible and visually appealing. There is nothing more you could ask from a timer app.
It would be better if there is a pause button in the app. Please do add the feature.
replyContent: There are pause buttons already.  Individual timer pause button and all timer pause button (stop button).  If what you need is something else, please send me the detail of your request to catfantom@gmail.com

content: I am using OPPO f5. this app cannot run in the background. If i accidentally close the app, it will not ring the timer when done.
replyContent: The app is following the standard logic to work in background and working in majority of devices. Check if your phone battery saver is killing or restricting the app.  Make sure "Use Alarm Clock" option is checked (App Menu - Settings - Alarm Settings - check "Use Alarm Clock function".) Send me email at catfantom@gmail.com if the issue persists.

content: Great utility. I can tell the developer(s) put a lot of thought and effort into it, worth buying.  One question, though. Is there a homescreen widget, or plans to include one in a future release? That would be all this app needs to be perfect.  Thanks!
replyContent: I don't know when I can implement it. But yes, it's one of the to do items to be implemented in one of the future releases.

content: So many settings! Unlimited presets, tons of color and sound options, as customizable as you could imagine.

I hate ads and this was an almost perfect app well worth the money. I use it to fix up weekly breakfast with friends. Everyone looks very full and satisfied with the well timed cooking this new years day. Happy New year everyone, enjoy your breakfasts.
An excellent app and the developer responded promptly and completely to my questions. Having the timers linked is incredibly useful when timing any operation composed of multiple discrete events.

content: I can't find anything to improve, after using previous and highly stable versions, and now more more configurable, themed, and prettier. Developer is highly responsive to suggestions.
Great tool. Use it every single day.

Intuitive, flexible, reliable. I love it and use the timers often. Some I labeled by purpose, and I have a bunch for set times. Just pick a button and start a 10 minute, 30, 60, and other intervals. (Simple things for simple minds. ;-)
Everything I need in a timer/stopwatch application. Never found any bug or had any problem. Super happy with it.

content: Very practical, I consider it the best App I have been using daily.

content: By far, the best multi-propose multi-timer on the Play Store. I use it for everything from cooking multiple dishes so everything is done at the same time to timing my gym workout rest times. I like the new icon, too. I've used this app for over two years and the dev always provides great support and keeps updating the app.
replyContent:
No default but whatever is displayed when closing the app will appear upon starting up..  If you close the app when timers are displayed, the timers will appear when you start the app next time.  Same for stopwatch.

Let me know if it's not working as I explained. Then there could be some conditions causing the issue.

content: Excellent timer when you have many things on the go.

I like the app a lot. It fills the need for having many preset times ready to go quickly. I just wish I could add custom notification/alarm sounds. All other apps I use allow adding custom sounds. All I get are the stock phone ones & no option for "others".

Best timer ever. Easy to set. Disagree with ErrolM: I LOVE the colorful icon! Enjoy the clever toolbar hour class icon full when timing, empty when timing over.  Also love ability to name notifications and set different tunes for each notification. Thank you! Just upgraded to Pro since I use it so often. Occasional problems with icon not staying in toolbar but stll 5 star app.
replyContent: Just released the new version and it uses the simpler icons as I mentioned previously.  In case you prefer to use the older version icons, please refer "Change Log" in the application menu.  That explains how to use the older version icons.

content: Good app  I will update as I figure how to use it.

content: Edit 5. A single request: a quick search box for timer name on top.  I saw my previous requests on this new version !   :-)   Thank you for made 6 of my previous requests.  Now, I use daily more than 75 timers. Thank you for all your efforts to make our life better !  P.S.  Btw, I am close to 100 total timers .. ha ha
replyContent:
Just released the new version. You can select the direction of the focus shift and the initial focus position.  Have a try as follows.

1. Menu - Settings - Timer Dialog Settings - Time Fields Focus Shift Direction - Left To Right
2. Menu - Settings - Timer Dialog Settings - Time Fields Initial Focus Position - Hour

content: I live in a building with washers on multiple floors. To use them all you have to be really on your game :) This app allows me to time everything I'm doing. It's great!! Nothing else like it that I could find. Certainly nothing as good.
Does what it claims with no problems.

I'm really impressed with this app! It has every feature I had wanted and lots more. It's very well thought out and has a great interface. Having an option to block Doze helps enormously. Beautifully done!
Kindly correct the spelling of some labels e.g. Timer Ext. (Sigle Tap) in the more options
replyContent: Thanks for pointing it out.  I'll correct them in the next release.

content: Uh, no, it isn't.  Nd what did u do to handle Doze mode?
replyContent: To handle doze mode, added an option to use Android Alarm Clock function. Try "Settings" -> "Alarm Settings", then check "Use Alarm Clock function" if you have any problems of doze mode. Or, send me an email at catfantom@gmail.com with the exact details of the problem you have

content: Used to love this - could set say for 2m and 4m at the same time, and they would ring at their respective times. Now, the first one doesn't ring at all, until 2nd one goes off! Useless!
replyContent: MultiTimer relies on Android alarm function to wake up from background.  Recently some devices have their own way of battery management which prevents alarm function sometimes (not always)...That's what you are seeing. I'll think of developing my own alarm function (wake up function) so that I don't need to relay on alarm function of those devices.

content: I juggle a lot of timers at work, and having a dedicated app to handle all of them is invaluable. I've used the free version for six months, but love it so much I'm buying the paid version. Totally worth it. Thank you guys for this app!
Please add ability to have multiple timer groups.
The is an excellent Timer. Very stable and functional.
to hide the Action Bar. I would like to have only an "add timer" button.
Love this app! I really miss being able to disable the screen turning on after a timer finishes on my Android 4.3 device though.
New version has all I wanted, it's near perfect.
Does the job brilliantly.

I use this app every single day, is very important and plays a big role while I'm at work. I was wondering, if you want to make this the best multi timer app, put that we have choices of colors,  such as back round font etc . Other than that, I like it.
I use this app all the time. A few bugs,  but otherwise one of the few worthwhile apps to have on your phone.

You should add a way to allow timers to automatically reset when they reach thier time limit, and also I would love if there was an option to have it show the actual time that it will be at the end of the timer.  Both features found on an apple store timer app a co worker uses.  I am unable to find an android app that has either or both of those features and works as well as yours. I still rate 5 stars because I use this daily for work! Thanks
replyContent: Regarding "timers to automatically reset when they reach their time limit", doesn't "Auto Reset Timer" option satisfy your need?  If it sets to true, timers will be reset automatically when alarm ends. If you need is something different, please send a detail requirement to catfaotm@gmail.com. thanks.

content: I use it during amateur radio nets as a reminder to ID, read repeater is in use messages, and call for new check-ins.
set it where we can have more than 30 countdown clocks
Paid for this app as soon as I saw how functional it looked. Such a practical app which I am sure I will use again and again after my perfectly timed Xmas Dinner!
The ability to start all timers at once to time the steps of something complicated is quite useful
Perfect
It need the delete all, stop all, etc to be on another screen or atleast menu button access... it is to easy to miss press after a 3hr cat nap

I work as a physical therapist in a skilled nursing facility where every minute counts. I am able to give the timers the patients' names, and assign different alarm sounds. It's especially helpful when I see 2 patients at the same time, but start them at different times to keep track. I give it 4 stars because I wish display would rotate and enlarge accordingly. Maybe in the next upgrade!? Thank you! -- I use it on my Galaxy S4 phone.
Problem with kitkat on nexus 4. Contacted Dev, updated and sorted.  Does just what I want. Thanks
Does it says it does.

Based on the description I thought it could do multiple stopwatches (as opposed to multiple countdown timers) but it does not.  I was a little disappointed because that's the functionality I needed, but I was able to find another app.  Other than that, good stable app.
This is a terrific little app. Versatile, highly functional, easy to use, and (so far at least) no bugs. If you need multiple timers don't hesitate to buy this one.

I use this app when proctoring exams for college students.  Three or four different exam types, with different time limits, start at the same time.  I need to give each exam type a 30-minute and 10-minute warning, plus an end time, so that's 9 or 12 different alarms I need and this does it all.  Since the actual start time can change from session to session, I used to program all the times as alarms using the built-in Android alarm clock for each exam session, which was a pain.  Now I have the timings saved and just press "start all" and the countdowns begin.  Thank you for making this app!!
Deserves 5 stars !

I needed to time a complex multistep procedure. This program worked great for that! (actually the free program worked great, and I was so happy, i bought the paid version to support the programer).    I was able to set up a ding right before a step was due to be done to warn me, and then a separate alarm sound when it was time to do the actual step.   I can't think of any missing features. Maybe an option to record myself to use as the alarm vs the pre programmed sounds on the phone (so I could i have the phone speak the steps to me).
